definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Nanzhao itself collapsed from internecine warfare shortly after the Tang Dynasty fell.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝滅亡不久，南昭國因內亂也開始崩潰瓦解。

sentences.english: Civil unrest in many of the countries where Lassa fever is endemic has impeded effective control.
sentences.chinese: 發生拉沙熱流行的許多國家的內亂阻礙了有效控制。

sentences.english: In feudal times, the inappropriate decisions of the successor to the throne often lead to civil strife in the court.
sentences.chinese: 封建時代皇家立嗣處理不好往往會引發宮廷內亂。

sentences.english: The army is threatening to take over if civil unrest continues.
sentences.chinese: 軍方揚言如果內亂繼續就實行軍管。

definition: to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
